org.instaware.core.service
Class WorkingLogic

java.lang.Object
  org.instaware.core.service.WorkingLogic

public abstract class WorkingLogic
extends java.lang.Object

An encapsulation of logic which is proprieted by a Worker.

Author:
Graham Edgecombe, Thomas Nappo

Constructor Summary

          Creates a new logic with a delay of 1 cycle.

          Creates a new logic with a delay of 1 cycle and immediate flag.

          Creates a new logic with the specified delay.

          Creates a new logic with the specified delay and immediate flag.

Constructor Detail

WorkingLogic

public WorkingLogic()
Creates a new logic with a delay of 1 cycle.

WorkingLogic

public WorkingLogic(boolean immediate)
Creates a new logic with a delay of 1 cycle and immediate flag.

Parameters:
immediate - A flag that indicates if for the first execution there should be no delay.

WorkingLogic

public WorkingLogic(int delay)
Creates a new logic with the specified delay.

Parameters:
delay - The number of cycles between consecutive executions of this logic.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the delay is not positive.

WorkingLogic

public WorkingLogic(int delay,
                    boolean immediate)
Creates a new logic with the specified delay and immediate flag.

Parameters:
delay - The number of cycles between consecutive executions of this logic.
immediate - A flag which indicates if for the first execution there should be no delay.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the delay is not positive.
Method Detail

isImmediate

public boolean isImmediate()
Checks if this logic is an immediate logic.

Returns:
true if so, false if not.

isRunning

public boolean isRunning()
Checks if the logic is running.

Returns:
true if so, false if not.

isStopped

public boolean isStopped()
Checks if the logic is stopped.

Returns:
true if so, false if not.

cycle

public boolean cycle()
This method should be called by the scheduling class every cycle. It updates the countdown and calls the execute() method if necessary.

Returns:
A flag indicating if the task is running.

execute

public abstract void execute()
Performs desired logic.

setDelay

public void setDelay(int delay)
Changes the delay of this logic.

Parameters:
delay - The number of cycles between consecutive executions of this logic.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the delay is not positive.

stop

public void stop()
Stops this logic.

Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the logic has already been stopped.
